what is New_Media?

New Media is humans playing, breaking, learning, building, fixing, and innovating with technology in search of new forms of communication, art and entertainment. It's anything, you make it – it's everything, you create it. New media is YOU experimenting with the power and mysterious possilbilities of technology.

types_nm

web + Interactive Design

learn_more

Animation

learn_more

Video Art + Design

learn_more

Or you can mix it up

learn_more

web & Interactive Design

If you decide to follow the web + interactive track, prepare to have your mind blown! We blend big ideas with web design, interactivity and a splash of performance art. You will learn how to create, code, and publish content for any device while mastering HTML5, Javascript, CSS3.


If you are as passionate as we are about creating interactive experiences by fusing the digital world of technology and web design with the physical world art performance, come join us!

Software Used

photoshop + illustrator + html + css + javascript + brackets + dreamweaver + max msp jitter

4_year Plan

To help you get started on this collegiate adventure of New Media, we have put together a 4-year plan that marks out the required classes involved in a New Media major focusing on Web and interactive design.

Freshman Year

+ Fall
nm_101 4
lang_120 4
la_178 3
sci_perspective 3
total_hrs 14

+ Spring

nm_231, 251 or 281 4
math_167 4
nm_142 (WI) 4
hum_124 4
total_hrs 16

total_hrs 16

+ Spring

nm_231, 251 or 281 4
math_167 4
nm_142 (WI) 4
hum_124 4
total_hrs 16

* Students in all New Media tracks MUST TAKE: nm_101, nm_231, nm_251, nm_281, nm_222, nm_438, and nm_490

* 14 hours REQUIRED outside of major: one course from csci_181 or csci_182; csci_344 or csci_346; math_167 or stat_185, or higher level MATH or STAT; and either phys_101 and phys_121 or phys_102 and phys_122

* Students are required to satisfy the DI and WI requirements from within the major. Course options are listed on the above schedules.

* Satisfactory completion of nm_438 with a grade of C or better domonstrates oral competency. Completetion of nm_490 with a grade of C or better domonstrates major and computer competency.

3-d & Animation

Our New Media's animation program was designed to prepare you for a career in this ever-changing field. You will continue to expand your artistic abilities and maybe learn some new tricks in 2-d and 3-d modeling, compositing, rendering, and rigging all with the latest software and technology at your disposal and that's just the beginning. Come check it out!

Software Used

maya + mudbox + 3ds max + flash + toonboom

4-yr Plan

maya + mudbox + 3ds max + flash + toonboom

video Art & Design

The video art + design track here at UNCA you learn the industry from the ground up. This program is all about hands-on-experience. You’ll learn the preproduction process: creating story, scripts, to the production process: shooting, lighting, recording audio, finally the post-production process: cutting, rearranging, and enhancing footage, recording and editing additional dialogue, sound effects, music, as well as adding visual effects and titles. With all of that and more, there can't be a reason not to sign up!

Software

final cut pro + after effects + premiere pro + max msp jitter

mix it up/dual focus

This is a dual focus track that blends the courses.


Why settle when you can have it all? It's understandable if you can't bring yourself to pick just one of these tracks, we get it. So why not double up and experiment with your own creative blend that fits your skill and interest? Try Animation/Video Art + Design or Web + Interactive/Video Art + Design. Here at UNCA, new media can be anything you make it!

Software

photoshop + illustrator + html + css + javascript + brackets + dreamweaver + max msp jitter + final cut pro + after effects + premiere pro + maya + mudbox + 3ds max + flash + toonboom

faq

this is the only question everyone wants to know...

What can I do with a nm_degree?

You can

do anything you want... no really!

join the cia!

be a film director.

design websites.

create interactive interfaces for hospitals.

build virtual reality environments.

start a revolution.

be a coder.

work from anywhere on your laptop.

be in politics.

brand the next US president!

be a digital editor.

become a youtube sensation.

work for Pixar.

start your own production company.

work a camera.

create music videos.

design user interface for surgeons.

make big bucks as a creative director.

be a graphic designer.

do research.

visualize data.

change the world.

create hilarious super bowl ads.

brand anybody or anything!

start your own agency.

be an educator.

...whatever it is

do it.

attitude is everything

Having the right attitude is key to thriving in the creative industry. Master these skills below and you will succeed! The first five were taken from this great article originally posted on AIGA.org, an incredible resource for aspiring designers/artists.

1. Be a pro-active doer

If you don't know what to do or find yourself stuck (which will often be the case when you're new in a job or just starting out in your career) ask someone who can give you the right answer.

2. Be a problem solver

Your drive to find the best solution should always carry you through this stage of any brief, especially when you feel you've exhausted all possible creative avenues.

3. Be an attentive listener

Design for the clients' needs, not what you think their needs are.

4. Be a passionate learner

As this desire to grow develops into action and learning, you become more valuable and, in turn, are delivering higher standards of work.

5. Be grateful

A small shift in perspective like this will not only have employers drawn to you, but you will begin to love challenges and have more energy in your approaches.

6. do what you're afraid to do

if the projects your involved in and the clients you're going after don't scare you, then push harder and aim higher.

7. enjoy it, it'll be over soon

It may seem like an eternity when you're up against a creative block but don't forget to enjoy that part of the process too – you'll find the gold!

Our_Story

We are an educational science experiment – a fusion of artist, designer, and computer scientist – and we've had very successful results. Check out where several of our alumni are now.

Our_Belief

“Experimentation is relevant to any discipline but particularly New Media because its new, so how are you going to know what's possible unless you play and break things to see how it works”

Curt Cloninger, Professor of New Media at UNC Asheville

this is the future

your_story?

typical graduate's portfolio


A graduate from UNCA New Media will leave with a diverse portfolio covering a wide array of concepts and skills. You will get the experience of experimentation across multiple disciplines, technological devices and software.

Dual focus in two tracks

Projects Completed by student on Web + interactive design track

Graduate's Portfolio listing all works completed while a student at UNCA New Media focusing in web & Interactive Design


  • Custom mythical creature
  • Promotional video using type animation
  • Responsive website featuring a non-linear experience that demonstrates the mystery of memory through interactivity
  • Director of an episode for a Independent Pilot Show
  • Experimental web-based scrolling collage built out of custom animated gifs
  • A collection of fine art pieces disassembled and animated into gifs that reveal the power of manipulation via digital media
  • Interactive mucsical interface website
  • 3-d animated short film
  • Music video
  • Personal logo
  • Pitch deck template
  • Stop-motion film
  • Abstract film
  • T-shirt design
  • Web application using an api that evaluates the sentiment of text and website urls
  • Custom typeface that was offered online as a free download
  • Realistic 3-d environment modeled, textured, and lighting in Maya
  • Narrative short film

create the life you want

Learn more at nm.unca.edu

location

unc asheville is located in the mountains of Asheville, NC, and has partnered with incredible creative companies in the area including Moog Music Inc, Bob Moog Foundation, The Black Mountain College Museum + Arts Center and The Center for Craft, Creativity and Design. Yes, the diverse spirit of new media lives here.

Contact

New Media is all about questions and finding answers and when you can't find any answers you create one. Get in touch if you have questions.

New Media at UNC Asheville

One University Heights
Asheville, NC 28804
